item.name: Surgical Tools
entries: Skill at surgery enables a character to treat injuries more effectively. A surgeon can mend broken bones, patch up wounds and remove parts of a body.

entries.name: Components
entries: Surgical tools include a scalpel, a needle, thread, sanitizer, bandages, salves, splints, pincers, and a magnifying glass.

item.name: Rayn's Charm
entries: This charm was created by the rock gnome and avatar of Nyarlathotep Rayn. At dawn while in the possession of one of these charms, you roll a {@dice d20} to determine the effect of the item according to the following table. Any effects fade away at dusk.

entries.name: Curse
entries: After willingly obtainig this item, it will always reappear on your person should you ever lose it. A remove curse spell, or similar magic ends the curse.

entries.name: Rayn's Charm
rows: You can only speak in one random language.
You hear a booming echo from everything.
You hear etherial music playing in the background completly inaproriate to the situation.
You think it is unbelievebly hot.
You think it is unbelievebly cold.
Your vision gets a sepia tint.
{@dice 1d4} living herrings appear in your pockets.
Your touch ignites flamable objects that aren't being worn or carried.
Your skin color turns into a vibrant green.
You are deaf on one ear.
You lose your sense of taste.
One of your body parts becomes invisible.
Your eyes start to glow brightly.

hp.special: 2 + your Intelligence modifier + five times your artificer level (the deucalion has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your artificer level)

trait.name: Aversion of Fire
entries: If the deucalion takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The deucalion is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form from anyone other than you.

action.name: Strike
entries: {@atk mw} your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage (your choice when you create the deucalion).

monster.name: Black Slaad

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The slaad's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The slaad regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the slaad fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} and not be able to regain hit points until the end of the slaad's next turn.

action.name: Tongue (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Chaos Spray (Slaad Form Only) {@recharge 5}
entries: The slaad exhales mucus in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 15d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: As a bonus action, the slaad magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendaryHeader: The slaad can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The black slaad regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The slaad casts one spell.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The slaad uses its Teleport action.

legendary.name: Tongue
entries: The slaad makes a tongue attack.

variant.name: Control Gem
entries: Implanted in the slaad's brain is a magic control gem. The slaad must obey whoever possesses the gem and is immune to being {@condition charmed} while so controlled.

Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against {@spell imprisonment}, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A {@spell wish} spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem.
A {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can remove the gem from an {@condition incapacitated} slaad. Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage to the slaad.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The slaad's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the slaad fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the slaad's next turn.

action.name: Chaos Spittle (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 40/80 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Temporal Echo (3/day)
entries: As a bonus action, the slaad can summon an echo of itself from the past or future. The echo has the same statistics as the slaad, but only 100 hit points, can't cast spells, can only make 1 attack, its claw attack doesn't stun targets and it can't summon more echos. The echo takes its turn immediately after the slaad's turn.

variant.name: Control Gem
entries: Implanted in the slaad's brain is a magic control gem. The slaad must obey whoever possesses the gem and is immune to being {@condition charmed} while so controlled.

Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against {@spell imprisonment}, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A {@spell wish} spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem.
A {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can remove the gem from an {@condition incapacitated} slaad. Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage to the slaad.

spell.name: Chaos Cloud
entries: You shoot forth a knot of roiling ethereal light that explodes at a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Inflict Madness

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 3rd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be afflicted with short-term madness for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

spell.name: Wilbun's Tentacle Arm
entries: You touch the arm of a willing creature turning it into a slimy tentacle. Until the spell ends, a creature can use its action to make an attack with the tentacle. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 1d4} acid damage and has the light and reach properties. In addition, you have advantage on grapple checks using the tentacle.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the acid damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wilbun's Words of Weirdness
entries: You flood a 30-foot cube centered on a point you choose within reach with energies from the far realm. When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage and suffers a short-term madness for 10 minutes. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and doesn't suffer a short-term madness. At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can repeat the saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or ending the madness on a successful one.
In addition, any spell cast within the cube triggers a wild magic surge. Roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to determine the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Demiurg
entries: TODO

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with surgical tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Demiurg Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Demiurg Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Deucalion
entries: By 3rd level, your experiments have spawned a horrible abomination, a {@creature deucalion|WWW}. It is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the deucalion stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You determine the creature's appearance and whether it has two legs or four; your choice has no effect on its game statistics.

In combat, the deucalion shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the deucalion can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

At the end of a long rest, you can create a new deucalionif you have your surgical tools with you. If you already have a deucalion from this feature, the first one immediately perishes. The deucalion also perishes if you die.
When you gain this feature, choose one of the following traits. Your deucalion gains that trait.

items.name: Aquatic
entries: The deucalion gains a swimming speed of 30 feet and the ability to breath underwater.

items.name: Spider Climb
entries: The deucalion gains the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving its hands free. It also gains a climbing speed of 30 feet.

items.name: Tunneler
entries: The deucalion can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and gains a burrowing speed of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Senses
entries: Starting at 3th level, you have created a strong psychic bond with your deucalion. As an action, you can see through your deucalion's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the deucalion has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

In addition, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your deucalion can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your deucalion must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Deucalion
entries: At 5th level, you gave your deucalion. When you gain this feature, choose one of the following actions. Your deucalion gains that action.

items.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC equals your spell save DC) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the deucalion can't use the same tentacle on another target. The deucalion has two tentacles.

items.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} your spell attack modifier to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h} The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

items.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} your spell attack modifier to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + PB} piercing damage.
In addition, your deucalion gains the following trait:

items.name: Multiattack
entries: The deucalion makes two strike attacks or one strike attack and uses the action it gained at 5th level.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Deucalion
entries: At 9th level, your experiments further altered the physiology of your deucalion. When you gain this feature, choose one of the following traits. Your deucalion gains that trait.

items.name: Cloying Miasma
entries: The deucalion is surrounded by a noxious stench. At the start of the deucalion's turn, any creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be poisoned until the start of the deucalion's next turn.

items.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the deucalion or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes acid damage equal to your intelligence modifier. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the deucalion corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the deucalion is destroyed after dealing damage.

items.name: Echolocation
entries: The deucalion gains blindsight out to a range of 30 feet. The deucalion can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Deucalion
entries: At 15th level, your mastery of body modifications grants your deucalion additional abilities.
When you gain this feature, choose one of the following traits. Your deucalion gains that trait.

items.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deucalion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

items.name: Regeneration
entries: The deucalion regains a number of hit points equal to your proficiency modifier at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

items.name: Tough Hide
entries: The deucalion gains a +2 to its Armor Class and has resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.
In addition, it gains immunity to lightning damage and the following trait.

items.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the deucalion is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to half of the lightning damage dealt.
